result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Rae Perkins Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dennis Rae Perkins Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dennis Rae Perkins Jr was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Dennis Rae Perkins Jr was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dennis Rae Perkins in court with attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on ct. 1, $243 costs, on ct. 3 Court imposed 10 days jail starting March 28, 2016 at 7 p.m., may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail. Huber granted under jail rules, may serve on electronic monitoring in Dane Cty. $1,442 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. 12 month IID, 12 month revocation, $65 blood draw fee.DNA sample be submitted. No jail credit.
Consent to Act filed by Atty Sasa Johnen- mail
